title: Help Center tile vertical centering + hover tooltip for full topic title

requirements.text: Adjust the Help Center topic tiles so the logo/text block is visually vertically centered by reducing the excess vertical space above the logo/text to match the space below it (frontend-only CSS/layout change). Apply the change only to the Help Center tiles in `frontend/src/pages/HelpCenter.tsx` and do not alter any data fetching, state, props, or behavior.

quotes: Reduce the visual height of each Help Center tile so that the space above the logo/text matches the space below it, resulting in the content sitting visually centered. Do not change any schema, data, backend, state, props, logic, or functionality. This is a frontend-only CSS/layout adjustment.

acceptanceCriteria: In the Help Center grid, each tile’s visible padding/space above the logo/text matches the visible space below it (content appears vertically centered).
Only layout/styling changes are made; no changes to backend calls, React Query hooks, component state, or click behavior.
Tile still opens the topic detail modal on click exactly as before.

requirements.text: Add a lightweight, text-only hover tooltip on each Help Center tile that displays the full `topic.topicName` when hovering over a tile (or the truncated title). The tooltip must not interfere with the tile’s existing click behavior or layout.

quotes: Also add a simple hover tooltip that shows the full topic title when hovering over a tile. The tooltip should be lightweight, text-only, and not interfere with existing tile behavior. Do not modify any other part of the UI or code besides what is necessary for these two visual updates.

acceptanceCriteria: Hovering a Help Center tile reveals the full topic title (including titles that are truncated in the tile).
Tooltip is text-only and does not block or prevent clicking the tile to open the modal.
No changes are made outside of what is necessary to implement the hover title behavior on Help Center tiles.

constraints: Do not change any backend Motoko code, schemas, stable variables, or backend interfaces.
Do not change any data models, React Query endpoints, application logic, or behavior beyond the specified visual/UX adjustments.
Do not edit files in `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only); compose existing components or use simple markup/CSS as needed.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding new Help Center features beyond tile height/padding adjustment and hover title display.
Redesigning the Help Center page layout beyond what is necessary to achieve the requested centering and tooltip behavior.
